One of my resolutions for this year,
and for the rest of my life really,
is to not tie my self-worth to my productivity.
And it's not that I don't want to be productive
But I also don't want to feel like a terrible human being when I'm not producing professional results.
But that has made me wonder. How do you even define self-worth, right?
Because obviously the ideal is having your own internal measure of success that is based on an unshakable

But really how do you implement that in your life?
Because I usually value myself based on my positive contributions to the world:
how helpful I am to humans and animals, and the strength of my support system.
But if all of that fell away,
would I still feel like I am worthy?

I am enough.
Just me as is.

If I had none of that to feel like I'm enough, I would need full self-acceptance and compassion and self-love.

to stay true to our values,
to live in authenticity as much as we can, and to forgive ourselves for our flaws while simultaneously
